Reviews.Title: “No service”
Reviews.Author: Clyde P
Reviews.Content: The service was the worst I have had. You call for towels, TP, etc. and they never show. This was very disappointing since we wher hoping for a nice but not fancy vacation. It says I must write more words so I wll write to fulfill the 200 character minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Not even if this is the last hotel with a vacancy in Branson........”
Reviews.Author: TracyJo81
Reviews.Content: Seriously, there are so many other places to stay in Branson don't even think about staying here. The front desk staff was friendly enough, but only provided lip service. There is no WiFi in the rooms. REALLY??? It's 2010!!! The rooms are very small for a family of four--the beds are too close together, not enough room for luggage or for hanging clothes. The furniture was scratched and worn, the mattresses were uncomfortable, and the walls were pretty banged up. Now to the really important stuff.....the bathroom floor was dirty and after showering, a horrible smell seemed to come up from the bathtub drain. The towels and wash cloths were thin, small, and felt like sandpaper. The TV set was a 19 inch tube TV that got very poor reception (channels were fuzzy). However, the worst thing was the air conditioner did not work properly. We kept it turned on full blast the first night and at best it only cooled the room to about 78 degrees. The next morning we stopped by the front desk and asked if it could be repaired while we were out for the day and they said it would be taken care of. When we returned that evening, hot and exhausted from a day outdoors, it had not been fixed as promised. We were so tired and it was late so we didn't ask for another room, hoping it would cool off. You can only imagine how hot it was in the room after a couple of people used a hair dryer on their hair! (Oh yeah, when we called the front desk and asked about the poor reception on the TV, all the person had to say was that the maintenance man was off for the day.) As we left on our final day, we stopped by the office to let them know that the air conditioner was not repaired after we made the request and the TV never reception was extremely poor. The repsponse.....? "I'm sorry." Seriously, there are many, many hotel rooms in Branson to choose from. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “seen better”
Reviews.Author: dgiager
Reviews.Content: we were told by Grand Crowne that this was a 5 star hotel....this isn't even close...it maybe a 2 star... we requested non smoking room,as soon as we opened the door it smelled like an ashtray....the texture on the walls didn't match,the bathroom door texture was coming off, I had to get up in the middle of the night Twice to fix the air conditioner as it just quit.... if you don't mind these things it will prob be a hotel for you.....the pools and hot tub were always crowded so we didnt even use them...and i had to goto the main office for wifi..

Reviews.Title: “GRAND CROWNE = HORRIBLE SERVICE & THIEFS!”
Reviews.Author: tnollt01
Reviews.Content: Do NOT under any circumstances believe anything these people tell you. They are liars and thiefs. Customer service does not exist. All they care about is how much money they can squeeze out of you. We had a medical reason why we could not travel, called to reschedule, not cancel mind you, and we were told they would have to charge us the cancellation fee because they had to cancel our reservation before they could reschedule. We spoke to "decision makers" at GC and they told us they did not have the power to change anything or waive any fees. We even told them we could provide medical documentation prooving I was not allowed to travel. DO NOT DEAL WITH THEM, you will be sorry if you do.

Reviews.Title: “They are crooked...don't deal with them!”
Reviews.Author: beauti2000
Reviews.Content: Through the time share presentation, we were told if we buy their timeshare they would refund all our monies paid to them if the one we own didn't sell. In other words, we had two already and didn't need another one, so they told us they would sell one of them, and if it didn't sell, they would refun all monies paid to them. They said they knew they could sell one of our other ones, because it was a well sought-after one. I didn't quite believe them, so I had them write it out on the contract, then both of us initialed it. We paid over $3000 to them, and after one year, lo and behold, we still had three time shares, which was way too much for our familiy, including all three maintenance fees! So we called them, and they said they didn't know what we were talking about. I told him the salesman's name and the promise, and the salesman called me back and was very, not only rude, but laughing and joking that I would think such a thing. So I told him it was in the contract, I could go pull it from my copies, and he laughed. So I went to our papers, and lo and behond, that paper wasn't there. I recall after them writing that statement and us initialling it, that they took the folder in the other room. I remember feeling puzzled why they were doing that, and they said they wanted to get an approval or something. I'm sure now, when that folder came back to me, that paper was gone!! There is no way to prove it, we are just OUT $3,000. We quit paying on it, and it gave us a bad mark on our credit report also. There is nothing we can do about it. Don't deal with them.!!!! Lest you find yourself in a similar situtation. Don't believe anything they say!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Crowne Resorts: Don’t buy any vacation package!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_Virginia_10
Reviews.Content: We went on a vacation in Pigeon Forge, TN which is associated with The Grand Crowne Resorts. During the timeshare presentation, we bought an 8day/7nights one-bedroom cabin package for the price of $995. At the time of purchasing, we were told there is one bed in the bedroom and one sofa bed in the living room so if we want to bring another couple there will be no problem. We had a one-year old with us at the time of the purchasing but nobody had told us there will be a limit on the people that can stay in the cabin. We were expecting another baby and our in-laws were planning to visit us so we planned to take them with us on the vacation. That is the reason we purchased the package otherwise we won’t buy a vacation in the place we already visited. At the same time, another free package was offered to us along with the cabin package. That package clearly states only two adults can stay in the room and two more kids are acceptable with fees of $5 per kid per night. But for the cabin package, there is no such information in the contract. So we assume that will be no limits. A few days ago, I called to arrange the reservation. We were planning to take our in-laws and two kids (a 10-month old and a 2-year old). However, during the phone call, I was told only four people are allowed in the one-bedroom cabin due to fire hazard issue. I told them the original contract did not specify anything anywhere related to how many people are allowed in the cabin. They said it is not in the contract but there is a limit. To me, this seems a fraud selling of a vacation package. When I called the second time, we planned that my husband will take my in-laws and one baby and I and the other baby will not go so that satisfies their 4-people limit. However, I was told that I have to be there for the purpose of the timesharepresentation. My husband alone is not enough for the presentation. There is no point for us to go there without the in-laws. We have been there and have seen everything we need to see. They did offer an option to upgrade to a two-bedroom cabin, but of course we have to pay another $500 to upgrade. We refused to pay any more. As I mentioned to the agent I was speaking to that they are just making things so difficult. She had a man, I suppose he is the manager, on the phone. He was not friendly and told me I can cancel my reservations. I said that then I wanted my money back. He just said it was not refundable. I was just frustrated and I hung up the phone. A few days later, I got a letter stating that if I want to reschedule or cancel the reservation, there will be fees (I don’t remember the exact price right now, but it is not cheap). This means if I want to forfeit $995 I already paid, I have to pay more to get nothing. So far my problem is not solved yet. I would not recommend Grand Crowne Resorts to anybody. If you already planned a vacation, don’t buy anything during the timeshare presentation. It’s a waste of money!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't turn in...get more for your $ down the road.”
Reviews.Author: moladytraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought a Timeshare tour for $109. and we could have stayed at most any motel in the area for this kind of money and it would have been cleaner, newer, and a much better value for our money...in fact, we've done that before. The furniture looked like a god had knawled on it, the indoor/outdoor carpeting was alright, but the bedding felt like it had pills on both the mattress pad and the sheets. The sheets were so thin...you could not tell if you had a sheet on. If you have claustrophobia, you won't like this room is small. I had asked for a handicapped room and the commode was but the tub, with its high sides had a shower curtain that tried to attach itself to me during the shower because the rod was set inside the shower by 6-8 inches. The only positive was Betty, the lady in charge of the breakfast area...she was pleasant. The breakfast bar had canned peached, no fresh fruit, English muffins, cereral, juice and donuts, along with milk and coffee. We ate here on the last day. It wasn't too bad. A word of advice...go on down Shepherd Hills Blvd., as there are many nice, clean, quiet, centrally located motels that offer amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Crowne Resort - not the Surrey Inn”
Reviews.Author: Baseballmom101
Reviews.Content: Well, let me start off by saying that this is definitely not a 5 star resort. The sheets are probably less that 200 thread count BUT they are clean, and the blanket was hidden in the bottom drawer of the entertainment center. Everything was clean, which goes a long way with our family. The two person jetted tubs are great but take forever to fill. The fact that we had 1500+ square feet for a family of four and they accept pets was awesome. We each had our own TV and bathroom. These units come furnished with dishes, pots and pans, a full size refrigerator, oven and four burner stove, microwave, dishwasher, washer and dryer and much more. The washer and dryer was a great feature, it was nice not to have 10 loads of clothes to do when we got home. I will definitely stay at the Grand Crowne Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, mediocre, mediocre”
Reviews.Author: MountainMurf
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here free for a Grand Crowne Resort time share promotion. We were to also receive a free 7 day/night cruise and a pair of designer watches worth $250. The hotel room was about average in every way. The location was good. The breakfast was nice and we were entertained by local musicians pushing tickets to their shows. We loved Branson, especially at Christmas time. We've done the time share promotion thing before and figured there would be some catches this time too. We were right. First thing is if you really have no intention of buying the time share, let the salesman know up front and never act interested. He will still push hard but it only lasts 90 minutes. The $250 watches turned out to be cheap watches selling new on ebay for $15. The free cruise turned out to cost at least $700 in fees not including the mandatory gratuities which is still not too bad. But you have to send them $100 before you even get the actual list of cruises to choose from. After all of the rest of the restrictions, we decided not to go on the cruise but we still had a great time in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Decorated and Large Floor Plan”
Reviews.Author: Bingobaeb
Reviews.Content: In August 2009, we traded our 2 bedroom Orlando resort through Interval International for this resort. I would have given this place five stars had it not been located in Branson, if it had a resort with activities for families (deadsville) and if it had an outdoor pool. It had tennis coursts and an inside pool that reminded me too much of being at the YMCA. But setting that aside, this had to be the nicest accommodations I have ever stayed in for a timeshare. We had the 3 bedroom/4 abthroom unit, which is really 3 condos tied together by a long common hall. I was traveling with my husband, 2 teenage boys and two teenage girls. So each twosome had their own separate bedroom, bath (ours had two full baths ), kitchen, living room, and laundry,. There were balconies with seating off two of the bedrooms. The furnishings were elegant, comfortable, and new. Some furniture stil had tags on them. Two jacuzzi tubs, stocked kitchen, & plenty of towels. A large dining table in the main unit. Six TVs all together. Even though we were on the first floor off of parking, we were actually elevated in back, overlooking woods and golf course, since there were walk down units. I do not think anyone could complain about the accommodations. As usual, in most domestic timeshares, you do not get cleaning while you are there, but can get fresh towels and garbage pick up as needed throughout the week. Location is okay. Check in is 3 miles from the resort in a separate building. A little timeshare tour pressure, when you check in disguised as "getting your parking pass" combined with "I can get you show tickets at a discount", but easily out of. Not on Branson Strip , but that main road seems to be a mess of things anyway, especially traffic, and I am not too thrilled with Branson anyway. Las Vegas meets the Wisconsin Dells. People are nice, but just a bit too touristy, too Country, and commercialized. We did the Titantic Museum, mini-golfing, the Ducks, the amusement park, the winery, rented a a boat for tubing and fishing, and some other things. I would not go back to Branson, but if you have to, stay here and get the 2 or 3 bedroom place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaPrincess09
Reviews.Content: I and three friends stayed at Grand Crowne Resort Surrey Inn in Branson Oct. 11-18, 2009. Rooms were clean, spacious, comfortable - lacking nothing that we needed to make our stay very pleasant. The staff was very helpful in getting tickets to shows and helped us pick out the best ones. All were fabulous! Everyone we met was helpful and interested in making our vacation as pleasant as could be. Can't wait to make a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy!”
Reviews.Author: Sept16
Reviews.Content: We had three connected timeshare units that were linked to each other, so we had three bedrooms, three kitchens, three living rooms, five baths, along with a washer/dryer set-up in each unit. While the "main" unit had the largest bedroom and kitchen/living room, all three units were more than spacious for our party of seven. (One person slept on a hideabed coach, but still had reasonable privacy and a private bath.) Overall, with the three units combined, this has to be the biggest timeshare resort we've stayed at. The location was terrific: off the main drag but near everything. Check-in was a bit confusing because it is totally seperate from the resort complex. Once we found it (after we mistakenly went to the much blasted Surrey Inn and were told where to go, but in a nice way!), check-in itself was quick and pleasant. There was the suggestion that we do the 2 hour timeshare spiel, but when we politely declined, that was the end of that. Our only recommendation is that the furnishings be replaced, sooner rather than later. The coaches and chairs especially are showing signs of wear and dirt stains, followed closely by the carpeting. When replaced, lighter, brighter colors would really help. That said, we would stay here again if we're ever back in Branson MO.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean and VERY Friendly”
Reviews.Author: mrsozarkrooster
Reviews.Content: Despite what other reviews may think about The Surry Inn, and they have have a right to their opinion, but I found it to be a clean and freindly place to stay. My husband nad myself have stayed at The Surry Inn many times. The hotel is an older hotel and it has been very well maintained. We like that it is located just off the busy Branson strip but yet still in themiddle of everything. You can get to the shows and attractions very easily. The rooms are very clean and no bugs that we ever woke up with. They have a great complimentary breakfast and even have shuttle service to and from the dining hall to your unit building. They staff has always been courteous and more than helpful. They have gone out of their way to help us with vaious needs.I look forward to staying at the Surry Inn whenever I have business to tend to or if I just want to get away from it all and relax. They are reasonably priced also which helps alot in this economy. I recommend this hotel to my friends and have had my extended family stay there as well. They like it too :)

Reviews.Title: “BUGS FOUND IN BED - WOKE UP TO CRAWLING CRITTERS AT 2:00 AM”
Reviews.Author: don2sante
Reviews.Content: WOW - unbelievable - And this was not the only thing. First let me say, I knew this was not a highly recommended place to stay. I took my chances. BUT I did not expect any of the follwing: 1. Bugs found in the Bath Tub. 2. Bugs found in bed while sleeping. ( this was the last night of our stay) 3. TV had a bad connection and was very fuzzy. They came to replace the TV with a smaller one. That one was worse. So we kept the original one. 4. Wall paper or what ever it was was peeling off the walls. 5. The sink drain was broken. It would close and water would fill up in the sink. I had to mess with it every single time we turned it on. 6. When I called after making a reservation to confirm my stay, some older guy answered, I asked if he had a few minutes of his time, he responded " No, actually I'm working" I did overlook that part and was still optimistic. ***The only good thing about it was the Hot water was working*** *** The maintenace Guy at night and the night checking in guy on the 8th were nice*** Get this, My wife checked out and expalined our situations to some young guy, and when she mentioned the Bug situation, he began to undertand and started to elaborate on a similur situation with the same looking bug!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Crowne Resort - Exceptional facility, friendly & attentive staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jan_001Missouri
Reviews.Content: We exchanged through Interval International for The Surrey Grand Crowne Resort. (Take note that this is NOT the same facility as the Grand Crowne Resort Surrey Inn or Carriage House.) The check in process was very quick and efficient. The rooms were available at 4:00 pm as stated. We reserved a 3 BR/3 BA unit. After reading many of the reviews on Tripadvisor, I have to say that we were a little concerned that the facility might not meet our expectations. Rest assured that if you stay at the Grand Crowne Resort, you're in for a real treat! The facility was absolutely beautiful and immaculate! Everything was simply fantastic! The rooms were spacious, the decor was elegant, and the amenities were perfect! Our room had a fabulous view overlooking the golf course. We had 3 bedrooms, 4 1/2 bathrooms, 3 full kitchens, 3 living areas, 3 washer/dryers, and plenty of extras! The resort is only a few blocks off the strip and close proximity to just about anything you could want to do in Branson. We had a large group of adults staying in the unit and were not crowded at all. The only complaint I heard the entire week was the Wi-Fi was sometimes slow or not available. Considering the number of internet users in our room, this was only a minor inconvenience! Overall, a fantastic place to stay! If I were going back to Branson, I would most definitely stay at the Grand Crowne Resort again!

Reviews.Title: “So bad we couldn't stay more than one night.”
Reviews.Author: ShelkaTexas
Reviews.Content: Originally, we booked this motel for 2 nights. After being put in a room in which the air conditioning did not work, we requested a new room. We were put in the room next door and once we realized that this air conditioner did not work either, we were told to contact the motel security since it was after 11 p.m. and there was no one working at the front desk. Horrible night, no one slept well due to the heat. After voicing our concerns the next morning while checking out, the old guy at the front desk was rude and seemed not to care whether our stay was enjoyable or not. I would NEVER recommend this motel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waist your money & vacation at this so called resort”
Reviews.Author: 2TRAVw3KIDS
Reviews.Content: Don't believe anything they tell you over the phone. The whole package deal is one lie after another! They will tell you what ever you want to hear. We took them up on their summer package where you sit through a 90 min. presentation of the resort. This is where you sit for 3 full hours and get lectured on how irresponsible you are for not buying into their time share. We simply wanted the free theme park coupons and thought this would save us some money. I wish we had simply bought the tickets from the ticket window!! These people are so rude I could'nt believe it. After the 20th time we told the salesman, and the manager, and the finance manager we were not interested, our sales lady actually got up and slammed the chair into the table and left without so much as saying goodbye. If your traveling with small children, don't put them through this. And don't trust the so called on site day care. What a joke! No way was I going to leave my kids with these people! When its finally over and they sign your slip, you have to drive all over town to get your vouchers. This whole ordeal waisted almost a whole day! Everything they told us before hand was a lie. We were told we would get a large condo with a fireplace. The condo was basically a little larger than a typical hotel room with a tiny kitchen. When I later asked why we didn't get a fireplace, they told me that none of the units have them. We have stayed at several resorts in Branson and all of them had several things to do with small children. But not this one. The only thing they have on site is one very cold and extremely cloudy indoor pool. Why would anyone have an un-heated indoor pool ? We had 3 very disappointed kids! And if you want the free breakfast they offer, you have to drive to another hotel to get it. Also room service is non- existent. When I called the front desk to ask for a towel exchange, they told me that each time they bring me clean towels it's a $6 charge! Basically you can't believe anything they tell you. They are your best friend until they have your credit card number. Do yourself and your family a huge favor by staying at a different resort. My family & I wish we had.

Reviews.Title: “A true dump of a place....do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: pbjk4
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family to attend the sales presentation and to get the $50 voucher. The font desk area is very nice but be wary, it does not reflect the rest of the so called "Inn". This is basically a dumpy motel. We checked in and this went fine but we were given a room with a huge water stain. The room smelled moldy and the air conditioner leaked. We asked for another room and were given a new one without hesitation. The new room was no better, just minus the water stain. We orginally planned to stay there 4 nights but checked out after our required 2 nights were up and went over the to Mariott. The breakfast was bland, cold cereal, bagels, muffins. The pool is small. No elevator so be prepared to haul bags up and down stairs. Most annoying of all, the ceiling tiles in the bath room would move and vibrate everytime the front door to the room was opened. Go figure! The "higlight" of our horrible stay was the sales presenation. We were told we could bring our kids with us but then after we arrived they put our kids into a play area where they were forced to wait for us. In hindsight, I should have insisted they stay with us. The sales pitch ended lasting about 3 hours. We did get a tour of the Grand Crowne Resort which is nice but be aware, the Surrey Inn is not on this property. Sales person was nasty and rude when we decided not to buy. I'm not an overly picky person about my hotel rooms. Just want them clean. This place is a dump! Nicer placed to stay in Branson in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “liars”
Reviews.Author: hogfanOklahoma
Reviews.Content: This was the most disapointing trip we have ever been on.The rooms smelled like cat and dog.The staff was rude.They have staff that works at both the grand crowne and short smalls.They are all in the scam together. They promise you a 300.00 gas card,and it turns out it takes you one full year to get your 300.00 dollars back.You will only receive 25.00 a month on a card,and it takes 8-12 weeks for you to get your first card back after you get set up on the program.The state should shut these people down.The totally misrepresent them selfs.please do you and your family justice do not stay at sorry inn.This is the first time I have ever taken the time to give a bad review,but these people are the worst I have evr seen!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Surrey Inn”
Reviews.Author: Joyce002
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and another couple stayed at the Surrey Inn for 3 nights. After reading the reviews, I was pleasantly surprised to find a speedy check in, clean rooms, very good maid service, a nice continental breakfast, and a speedy check out. The hotel is located near Walgreens, restaurants, and several show theatres. Parking is right in front of our room. Quite handy to say the least. Not the Hilton, but I didn't pay for the Hilton. We were very comfortable to say the least. My friends said the same thing. We both had a very good stay at the Surrey Inn. Thanks, Joyce, Lake Charles, La.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - Really...”
Reviews.Author: Maryhof
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about this place after reading the negative reviews. I was pleasantly suprised. The rooms are not 5 star hotel type rooms but ours was clean and in good shape. There were no smells and no bugs. The only issue was a faulty GFI, we told the housekeeper and it was fixed when we got back later that afternoon. The entire area looked to be kept up. There was plenty of amenities if you needed them. 2 outdoor pools, one indoor, hot tubs, horseshoe pits and close to everything. The continintal breakfast was very good, and the service was awesome. The only issue is the number of seating and tables if the hotel is full. All the service was very good. After driving by and seeing many hotels in Branson, I would say this is one of the better ones, no, not the top notch 5 star hotel but very practical. The sales pitch was as usual, you need to be prepared for that. If you don't want to purchase then say no, several times... The gifts or rewards they offer are a bit of a hassle but nothing your can't overcome. I would recommend this place and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Low price and Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: DarrisPaige84
Reviews.Content: I went on an advertisement that I received on the phone. I paid $99 dollars to go during the week and I received $50 for entertainment or food. In all I really paid $49 for 3 days and 2 nights in Branson! The Surrey Inn Hotel had very nice accomodations, not at all what I expected going into it. The room was very clean! We went to a presentation during our stay and the resort was very respectful. If I had an option to revisit for the same deal, I would not hesitate. The only thing that I could complain about is that we didn't stay long enough!

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSteph
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carriage Place over spring break in a combined 1 &2 bedroom units Nice condo overall. Very clean. We did have to call maintenance to come fix the ice machines in both units, unplug a toilet and fix a ceiling fixture. The toilet in the master bath ran constantly and one of the windows would not shut in the living room after we opened it. Like the location, close to Hwy 76, the teenagers could walk up to the strip. The kids really enjoyed the gameroom in the basement. There were not many planned activities for younger children. Did not like not having wi fi internet access in the condo, you have to go down to the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Grand Crowne Resort”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl6
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Branson and stayed at the Grand Crowne Resort, not at the Inn. We had a 2 bedroom condo which was very nice and clean. The master suite had a huge jacuzzi tub which was quite relaxing. The only improvement I might suggest would be reading lights over the bed instead of the bright lights that were in place. Everything was clean and in working order. Upon check-in, we did get a bit irritated because our room was not ready when promised. We did have to wait about 45 minutes longer to get our room key. They said it was a plumbing issue; not sure if that was just a line or not. But in the end, it was definitely worth the wait. The kids loved the indoor pool as it was still too cool outside to swim outdoors. The chlorine level was definitely too high though. But the pool hours were great; the kids were able to come back after a late show and get some swim time in before bed. As far as the presentation goes, we pretty much knew what to expect. We knew it would be a hard sales pitch; that's why the accomodations were so affordable. Mike, our salesperson, was very professional and did not try to force anything on us at all. We did not feel overly pressured in any way. And yes, we did end up purchasing a small package from them and are looking forward to using our first week soon. The only complaint we had was that once we agreed to the purchase, the process took a while to complete, making us late for another event we had planned. But all in all, it was a great vacation. The location of the resort in reference to all of the attractions was great. We only hope that our future vacations with Grand Crowne will be just as enjoyable. I would definitely recommend the Grand Crowne Resort to other families looking for an affordable vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “would never go back”
Reviews.Author: fireftnchick
Reviews.Content: This stay was booked by Grand Crowne to get us to listen to a time share presentation. Well, the first red flag was the phone call AFTER reservations were made AND confirmed to book with them for a presentation! Basically whatever we paid for this trip was too much, in my opinion. We arrived and were SADLY disappointed. First the hours on the welcome center were not accurate and we ended up with a late arrival packet, which was basically an envelope with a coupon book and a tour time listed on the front. First, the lobby and breakfast room were nice, but not even close to the rest of the hotel. Since when is a HUGE hill and outdoor room access an acceptable standard? Since it was so late, we really had no choice. We decided to tough it out for one more night after that. My son is allergic to dust, dust mites, cockroaches and tobacco. We had him on breathing treatments the whole time we were at this hotel, not actually realizing it was the hotel causing the problems (the other hotels we did not have the issue, that is how I know). We suffered through the 2 nights to avoid uprooting the kids. We just made sure we spent as little time as possible in the room...very inconvenient. We tried to use the "indoor" pool, but it was VERY cold. Who has an unheated indoor pool anyway? How exactly would it warm up with no sun? The hot tub was so hot, my husband didn't even want to use it. There were no pool towels, we had to use our shower towels. To get more, we had to go to the front desk as no one was available to bring them to the room. So the only amenities the hotel offered were a huge bust and I had VERY disappointed kids. WIFI access was only from the lobby or breakfast room area. Did I mention the spiders or the envelope left in the room for tips? Maybe in Branson that is OK, but in IL it is considered soliciting tips. It is considered rude and discouraged. There was a guy in a golf cart giving people rides up the hill. He also had a tip jar. In the breakfast room ,(well laid out compared to all the other hotels) there was yet ANOTHER tip jar. Breakfast was OK, nothing special, but my boys were OK. The next morning we went to the welcome center to check in and someone booked the wrong date on our tickets...for the previous day. I was listening to my husband on the phone booking these tickets and heard the dates he gave them. They acted as if it was OUR mistake, it was theirs. It was eventually corrected. We do not allow our kids with strangers and kept them with us during the presentation. This is NOT negotiable at any presentation or we walk out-incentives or not. We got our $50 and left after a rather short presentation in the grand scheme of things. As it turns out Grand Crowne actually owns only one property, they own an "interest" in other properties and you basically pay a $70 fee to vacation at any resort, even as members. Frankly, what is the point? I can book my own vacation for that! So all in all Grand Crowne was a HUGE disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING..............STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: roger1920
Reviews.Content: We were contacted from Grand Crown Resort Surry Inn. We paid for two nights stay ahead of time $139.00 total. We were offered a few perks with this to come and listen to the time share presentation. We thought ...with the perks how bad can it be? Little did we know how "crazy" this time share scam could be! As mentioned in some of the other reviews we had to go from one location to another and then ended up at the hotel.... Surrey Inn....What a dump! It was dirty and the room smelled like a smoking room......when we complained they said there was no where they could put us. The time share presentation the next day went ok...again a nice friendly sales person but than the manager comes in to treat us very rude!! They are a disgrace to all sales people and the pressure they try to put on people is a joke!! IF there time share is such a good deal they would not have to give such incentives and pressure to have folks buy. I cannot believe that the BBB and the chamber of commerce do not have better regulations and laws on these companies that operate in Branson! As I mentioned we were offered some free shows and other perks to listen to the timeshare. Even with these perks it simply is not worth your time and money!! They offered a gas card called FreeBeeGas.com which was suppose to be a $300.00 certificate rebate card. After looking into it when we got home...it is but another scam! I hope that you do listen to these comments and read them before you go on vacation and not after like we did. Please listen to the advice you are hearing here and stay away from Grand Crown Resorts...You will see them on almost every corner of Branson...offering great deals! Thanks, Audrey & Roger Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Bad Child Care at presentation”
Reviews.Author: Sydbry
Reviews.Content: We didn't have any problems with the Surrey Inn itself. The stay was nice, the employees friendly and the rooms were clean. My problem was at the presentation. We have three kids ages 8, 6, and 2. We were told they could stay in the kids room. It looked ok and the girl in charge seemed friendly. We left my husbands cell phone with our 8 year old daughter. ( Thank God ) The tour guide/salesman we had was really nice and so were the other people. Even when we told them we weren't interested they were nice. My daughter called and asked us how much longer and a told her only a little bit. It ended up taking over three hours. She called about 30 minutes later crying, so I walked down to get them to bring them up there with us. She told me that the girl kept yelling at my 2 year old daughter and that she said she was going to spank her. Oh my God! I flipped out. The manager told me I couldn't speak directly to the girl and that I had to make a formal complaint through him. Yeah right. I pushed past him and went to the girl myself. She denied it and said my two older kids were lying. I would not recommend doing this timeshare if you have children!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: pb1333
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Crowne Resort in Branson in August 2008. Very hot, 100 degrees but cooled to 90 at the end of the stay. Spent some days in the cool shows and in the pool. But overall, had beautiful weather that week. I traded my Marriott guest room that I had through Interval international for a 3 bedroom condo. I want to note that the Grande Crowne has 3 separate places here, Carriage Place, the Surrey Inn and the Grand Crown. Carriage Place is more 'in town" and looked slightly older than the Grand Crown which was on Golf Rd. and situated on a Golf Course. It had an indoor pool with a tennis court on top. We had a nice golf course view. The 3 bedroom was huge. 5 bathrooms, 3 kitchens, 3 living rooms, 2 of the bedrooms were masters with whirlpools. The furnishings and carpet were average, nothing fancy. I own at a Marriott and am a little spoiled with their furnishings. But it was clean and had 2 balconies. We did not have wireless internet in our building but had to go to building 6 in the lounge for wireless. A little inconvienient but it kept us from surfing the internet and we actually played cards with each other. It was close to everything. Within 5 minutes you were on the main drag where all the theathers were. Branson landings, the downtown shopping area was 10 minutes away. Branson has some traffic, but you learn quickly what streets you take to get around it. As far as the time share complaints...we were asked twice to attend a time share presentation. The first time was right at check in, when they send you to someone to get a parking pass...it was so they could ask about a time share presentation. I said no...that was that. A few days later I got a call asking if we would come down and give our opinion of the resort. I asked if this was for a time share presentation, she said yes, and I said no thank you. That was the end of it. No one bothered me again. They were all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent”
Reviews.Author: jkraub
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty good. It wasn't fancy, but was very clean. The free breakfast was good. It wasn't extravagent, but had more than just some donuts. The biggest downside was the lack of internet in the rooms. The only place to get internet was in the lobby/dining room or in a computer room, which I never visited. We had to listen to a timeshare presentation, but overall it wasn't that bad. It took us 1 hour and 45 minutes total. We spent the first half an hour or so listening to the speech, then we got on a little bus and toured 3 different condos. After that we had a little break and then we had to have our individual talk. The main guy, Johnny was a bit annoying, but he definitely has done this for awhile. Our individual girl was very nice and wasn't pushy at all when we politely informed her that we would not be purchasing a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: dustykat
Reviews.Content: I entered to win a free vacation on the internet. FIRST MISTAKE! A salesperson contacted me (with emphasis on they contacted me) and I bought the 2 night package. I requested to stay at the Carriage House condos and they told me it was no problem. When I called and booked the dates I was told I would stay at the condos but after receiving my confirmation letter and reviewing it closer I noticed that we were booked in the Surrey Inn. I called and was told there were no vacancy in the Carriage House condos. The Surrey Inn was less than desireable. When we got to the presentation the 90 minutes ended up being 4.5 HOURS!!! We were not going to purchase the timeshares but a manager came over and both my husband and I "misunderstood" the payment length and decided to buy thinking the payments would only be for 3 years. When we went to close the loan officer had us signing an agreement saying the payments would be for 10 years almost doubling the price of the timeshare . When we backed out she told us she could drop the interest rate 5 points! They could have done that to begin with then. We were both so infuriated by this time we refused. Also, we had a nice salesman but the manager and the loan officer both talked down to him. I hope he finds a better job! If you are looking for a timeshare, I would be very careful.

Reviews.Title: “Our room smelled of Cat Pee!”
Reviews.Author: fancyfacebags
Reviews.Content: We were solicited of course over the phone and did not choose this "Sorry Inn" ourselves. The room smelled strongly of cat pee which my son announced proudly at the Bob Nelson Comedy show. Needless to say it got great laughs and everyone wanted to know where we were staying. I highly recommend finding another place...even a motel 6 would be nicer. The 90 min. presentation went for 120 min and longer because they don't let you go if you say you are not interested. But honestly who would want to be an "owner" of a resort with property like this one. They have nice rooms but those are only for show. That isn't where they let you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably rude people”
Reviews.Author: Kimcar
Reviews.Content: The Grand Crowne Resort people are incredibly rude...once you tell them you aren't interested in their over priced time share deals. I have never seen anyone turn so ugly, so fast in my life. What amazed me the most was how they talk up their resort & timeshares as being 5 star locations, all while serving potential investors juice, donuts & fruit. Nothing about that is 5 star treatment in my opinion. We listened to the spiel the lady gave us and when she invited us to tour the facility, we declined. We knew right then that we were not interested and did not want to waste her time, or ours. She kept telling us she was going to get into trouble because it was her job to "warm us up" for who ever was going to try to close the deal. That little blunder was the last thing I needed to hear to validate my initial feeling of unease. These people are NOT your friends, they are sharks looking to feed. Needless to say, this encounter completely turned me off on Branson. We will not be going back. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “total ripp off”
Reviews.Author: rippedoff69
Reviews.Content: total ripp off. They steal your money in a package when you show up they say you don't make enough the put you in a motel with bugs and the Grand Crown is rude. I will never go to Branson again.The whole trip is a wast of money they take old people's money. The condo they are selling are broken down shacks, with bugs and snakes. the food at the motel made us sick for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, nice area”
Reviews.Author: dsweet10004
Reviews.Content: We were invited to tour the Grand Crowne resort in Branson, with the stipulation that we participate in a 90-minute presentation. The unit that we stayed in was a large two bath, one bedroom, spa tub and separate shower, full kitchen. The resort is still in the building process but the area was quite and the grounds well maintained. The Branson area is very nice, lots of things to do, even in the winter months. The presentation went well, we actually purchased a week. We were treated fairly, no high-pressure sales.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped- Off”
Reviews.Author: joanna_orange
Reviews.Content: My husband and I received a telephone call from Grand Crowne Resort in August 2007. We were not particularly interested in their timeshare because we had just purchased from Wyndham. My husband stated why we were not interested when the representative asked, but then we were told we would receive a $1000.00 on line shopping spree if we visited their location and listened to their sales pitch. When my husband told me about the shopping spree, I immediately said yes. To make a long story short, we did not receive the on line shopping spree, but two $30.00 vouchers for a restaurant. We immediately voiced our complaint, we were told different reasons by the different representatives we spoke with. In the end we were given a voucher for a vacation sponsored by Grand Crowne Resort, which we will not activate. My husband and I decided to check out early, due to the false advertisement and the negative feedback we received.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Sticky Fingers”
Reviews.Author: BamPa65
Reviews.Content: O.K. Stay... However...CAUTION....We forgot a Digital Camera when we checked-out(which we reported the same afternoon) and even with all that security has been able to do, someone who had access to our room now has our camera ....................visitors beware

Reviews.Title: “We hope this helps you in your decision to stay at the Surrey Inn”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaFirstTrip
Reviews.Content: Good stay, 2nd level of building 2. Good continental breakfast,had room service but didn't need. Easy presentation that took 2 hours. Great rooms at the timeshare but beyond what we would need. Bob H. was our presenter and did a great job explaining of the point system. Not for us but want to wish Bob a great future. We are thinking of you and wishing the best. Surrey Inn is across from Stone Hill Winery, close to the shows and clean rooms. Yes we would attend another stay at Branson and at the Surrey Inn in a heart beat. We are not eligible for 12 months and may go back. The timeshare is not for us at this time and I wonder if it will be in the future. Hear many negative things but if this is your lifestyle go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Death of My Husband”
Reviews.Author: inadaze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought a trial package for $995.00 in 1-07, while staying on a weekend package. He died of a heart attack on 4-29-07. I very kindly requested refund of all or part of $995.00 for the trial package. A VERY cold-hearted and non-empathetic SHERRY CARPENTER made the final decision to NOT reimburse me at all, using her phone cronie Sharon to relay the message! There is NO BEREAVEMENT CLAUSE in the contract, but after phone calls and letters, with kindness from me, they remain cold, rude and non feeling. SHERRY CARPENTER has not even had the courage to talk to me personally. I hope she thinks of me when her time comes.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Funtravel82
Reviews.Content: We traded through II for this week in Branson. I feel that II rates this property too high. The room was clean. There is no room service. There are two pools on the property and they are both small. There were very few chairs to lay out. They had outdoor grills, which was nice. It was much like staying in a hotel vs a resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff are Liars”
Reviews.Author: bullet112233
Reviews.Content: Conn artists at there finest!!! We were cantacted by them about staying in one of there condos for the weekend and going to one of there 90 minute meetings. I said no. They then told me that for 37 dollars more I did not have to go to this meeting so I agreed. When we arrived in branson to check in, they told me that my meeting was at 11:30 the next morning. I said no, I upgraded to no meeting. They said they had no record of that. I said you had my money, but that was not enough for them. They told me that if I did not attend their meeting they would not give me my hotel rooms and they would not give me the show tickets I had bought through them. Reluctantly I agreed to go. The meeting went an hour longer than it was supposed to go, and then they maid me go to a third location to recieve my tickets for the show I had purchased.. After all this I can say that I will never have anything to do with them again!!

Reviews.Title: “sorry inn”
Reviews.Author: cbwhitledge2717
Reviews.Content: The Surrey Inn experience is one that I don't want to do again. I had never been to a timeshare experience and will not go to another one. I recently went to the Surrey Inn and when we arrived everything appeared to be great. It was not until we checked into our room and the fleas started biting that we changed our mind. I reported this to the front desk and the only thing she could say is, "I'm Sorry." We did make it until the next day and the nightmare continued. The man presenting the timeshare to us was very nice until the moment came for me and my husband to sign our name. He became very angry when we would not sign up for the timeshare. At one point I actually felt like I was going to cry because he was being so hateful. The timeshare was 38,000 dollars financed at 19.9 percent. How can they actually expect someone to buy a timeshare with those rates? The presentation lasted 2 hours and 30 minutes. We checked out of the SORRY INN right after we got our one free show ticket. I WILL NEVER DO BUSINESS WITH THE GRAND CROWNE AGAIN. If you have any questions I will be glad to anwer them at cbwhitledge@hotmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: bl0ndie087
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Dec. 24-31, and we loved it! The location is a little out of the way, but I liked it that way. We actually stayed in 2 units, they were connected with an adjoining door. The first unit had 1 bedroom with a king size bed, master bathroom with jacuzzi tub and shower, it also had a spacious living area, and dining room..as well as a full kitchen. The second unit had 1 bedroom as well, that had a queen size bed, a bathroom, a living area, and a full size kitchen too! We also brought our small dog, and were able to get a pet unit with no problems! Overall this hotel was very nice, only downside is that workout room is very small, with just a few machines, and the pool is small too. We did lose power for a short time, but it came back on within 15mins. I would definetly stay here again, very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice condo.”
Reviews.Author: Eagle_Baseball_Wife
Reviews.Content: We spent Veteran's Day weekend in Branson and stayed at Grand Crowne Carriage Place. We stayed in a 2 bedroom penthouse. It was a nice condo with 18 foot ceilings and ceiling fans in each room. It is not as spacious as Fairfield condos, but was perfect for the 4 of us. There were a few minor inconveniences, first of all the second bedroom didn't have a TV. Secondly, there were not a enough pots, pans and cooking bowls in the Kitchen. There is plenty to make a small meal but we usually cook a big breakfast and we had to double up on bowls and pans. Also, they do not have DVD players and the VCR was an older model without a remote. We did call maintenance and they brought us a new VCR with in minutes, so we could plug in our PS2 and watch our DVDs. The master bathroom was very spacious and the Jacuzzi tub was the biggest we have seen. They do not have hair dryers in the bathrooms. It is not as up to date as some of the newer resorts but it was very clean and the check in staff were very friendly. The building has an elevator right in front and a game room in the basement, which our boys loved. They have trash collectors on each floor which is nice. The boys has fun at the indoor pool, it was clean and close by. The location of this resort is the best, it is right off Gretna with easy access to Green Mt. Drive and 76 Blvd. We were in Branson on one of the busiest weeks of the year and parking was not a problem at all and within feet of the elevator. We would stay in this resort again, all and all it was very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Crowne Resort Stay”
Reviews.Author: notanokieever
Reviews.Content: After all the negative reviews, I was very hesitant about my stay, but I shouldn't have been. The rooms were small, but nice. Check in time took about 5 minutes and the clerk at the desk was very pleasant. The only thing I didn't like was not having Wi-Fi access in our rooms. Our sales person was awesome! The tour and information part took a little over 90 minutes, but that was due to me, not the sales rep. We were having too much fun joking around and visiting. The penthouse was awesome and so were the regular condos. I am definitely going to consider this deal, but didn't buy it at the time. Too much information in a short time. My son and I travel quite a bit, so I think it could be beneficial to us. I have never been on one of these timeshare things, so it was a new experience for my son and I. I didn't do the exit interview...$40 to sit through an exit interview or spend my money in Branson shopping and eating! I opted for the latter. My son and I had a great time. The weather was great and the people were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: nealkate6
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long, miserable weekend at the Surrey Inn in Branson, MO. After reading the reviews on this site and a couple of Branson sites, I did not have high hopes for this place -- thank goodness. I would have been sorely disappointed if I had. I want to state now that we were there for a family reunion, not for a timeshare spiel, and most of the misery came from Branson itself. We'll not go back. We arrived at the office to check in at 4:40 in the afternoon. The two or three parking spaces "FOR CHECK-IN ONLY" were taken, so we parked as out-of-the-way as you can park a Suburban. I sat in the car in with the kids while my husband went inside to check us in. 35 MINUTES LATER he emerged with our room keys and what was supposed to be an information sheet and map about the Surrey Inn. By that time seven more cars had pulled in to check in, and none of the other cars had left. Apparently the front office people were having a staff meeting and could not be disturbed to help their visitors. My husband said that once the staff decided that maybe they should see to their customers, the check in process took about 5 minutes -- the standard amount of time usually required to check into a hotel. We had booked two rooms, one for the kids and one for us, and had told the booking agent that we needed adjoining rooms because our children are way too young (9, 8, and 4) to stay in a single room. When we found our rooms we discovered that not only does Surrey Inn not have any adjoining rooms, they had put us in two rooms separated by a breezeway. So, needless to say, my husband stayed in one room, and I stayed in the other; we split the kids between us. Not the fun vacation we'd envisioned. My four year old son and I headed to our room to settle in. He knelt on the floor to play with his Matchbox cars. I inspected the facilities -- very dark, rather small, a little dusty with a lingering odor of dirty wet socks, but okay. Then my son got up from the floor to use the restroom, and his shins had black specks on them. I thought it was just dirt and moved to brush it off, but upon closer inspection I found that he had two MOUSE pellets from the floor embedded in the skin on his knees. I grew up on a farm; I know what mouse poop looks like. YUCK! I called the front desk four times and no one ever answered the phone. I got my little broom and can of Lysol out of my car, swept as best as I could, and sprayed everything with Lysol. I looked for a hotel directory, but there was absolutely no information regarding the hotel anywhere in the room. We headed to the indoor pool. It was dirty, there were no towels, the jacuzzi was blocked from use, and there was a very loud, hyperactive little boy with a rather large uncovered gaping wound on his side jumping in and out of the pool, along with about thirty other kids. We headed to the central outdoor pool, and it was great. Still no towels, but it was uncrowded and very pleasant. We also swam in the pool by the office, and it was nice, too. The next morning we hit the breakfast buffet. It consisted of apple juice, orange juice, coffee, hot water (for tea or whatever), packets of oatmeal and hot chocolate, a large bowl of apple sauce, bananas, white bread for toast, English muffins, margarine, jelly, cream cheese (no bagels, though), Cheerios, bran flakes, cartons of skim milk, and LOTS of doughnuts. I went to the grocery store and bought "our" cereal, and we just took it to breakfast with us the next few mornings, which won many admiring glances and several requests for Fruity Pebbles from the other diners. My son still naps at 2:00 in the afternoon. Guess when the maids come around to make up the rooms....yep -- afternoons. That's kind of strange since check-in is at 1:00 or so. Needless to say, my son did not get a good nap while we were there. Each time the maids came to clean the room, they acted surprised to see us, then shoved clean towels in our hands and left. No beds made, no vacuuming, no garbage emptied. Our family reunion gatherings were held in the Owner's Lounge, a dark, dirty cave located outside the central pool. We brought in our own food and paper plates; the resort let us use their flatware and didn't require us to wash it. We would have been glad to wash it if they'd applied that time to at least vacuuming the room. It was nasty. The tables and counters were sticky, and most of the lightbulbs were out. The floor was so dirty that it turned the toddlers' feet black within minutes. The kids spent most of their time in the gameroom across the sidewalk, which sounds great, but unfortunately, everything in the gameroom is coin operated, so we were constantly scrambling for cash. If it weren't so grossly dirty and poorly staffed, I would give the Surrey Inn an okay recommendation. It's very similar to a $19.95 roadside motel -- absolutely no frills, kind of old and funky. However, the filth is inexcusable, and the staff needs to be changed and trained. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Evaluation - hah!”
Reviews.Author: shan0107
Reviews.Content: We paid $139 for 3 nights, 4 show tickets (limited), and another 2 night vacation. The 90 minute presentation was very pleasant with no hard sell. We weren't buying because a time share will eventually be handed down to us. We were so impressed that we told them we might eventually sell ours and go with their company. We were asked to do an "evaluation" the next morning and we would get $40 (plus our $20 deposit back). At the "evaluation" we quickly realized they didn't want our feedback, they wanted to sell us something else! The same lady who at the beginning of the presentation asked if we had been treated nicely, ended up calling us "moochers" because we didn't want to buy into their travel program! When I got upset, they said they were going to call security on me! It was funny that back at the office, they had a stack of complaint forms handy! I noticed on another posting that someone else was called a "moocher". They definitely lost our future business! How RUDE!

Reviews.Title: “MY Biggest Mistake was participating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I responed to a radio ad from KKIN in northern Minnesota. Called Grand Crowne and agreed to participate. Was promised 4 tickets to the "premium" shows and two nights at a motel. I had to agreed to listen to a 90 minute sales pitch for time shares (it actually ran 2 hours) I also agreed to purchase a $29.95 coupon book. When my wife and I arrived to check in I found out that the premium shows do not include the two I wanted to see, Soji and the cruise on the showboat..they do not belong to the Grand Crown package plan. Went to see Soju on our own. When costs are figured in out of the $295 I paid- I received show tickets worth about $150 and a worthless $29.95 coupon book (like a happenings book) and two nights at BoxCar Willies hotel. When you look at what I paid, it figures out that I paid about $75 a night for the motel room. Better to book motels on the web and contact individual shows as to where you want to go. Then you have no obligations. You stay where you want and go to the shows you want and no obligations.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was surprisingly pleased. I also read all the negative reviews and really had the heartburn about the upcoming trip. My mother, my aunt, and I were welcomed with smiles and had a fantastic time. Checking in was a breeze. The show tickets were great! The timeshare spiel was very brief (not even the full 90 minutes). I was not pressured at all. Everyone was very friendly. The hotel was clean. The breakfast consisted of a few sweet rolls and bananas-- so be prepared to eat a breakfast buffet elsewhere. The concierge was very helpful. Our only disappointed was the town closes down at 10, so eat before your shows. Don't waste the time, gas, or money to see the Fantastic Caverns. Not worth it. The Broadway show and Jim Stafford were well worth the money. The Titanic museum was awesome! We really had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Crowne Resorts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were scheduled to stay at the Surrey Inn approximately two years ago. We had paid our $125 plus dollars as a requirement for the travel package/ resort sales promotion and looked forward to our time in Branson. Due to unforseen circumstances we were not able to make the trip at that time and as time past were under the impression that the promotion period for us had expired and we had lost our money. We received a phone call a year or so later and were told the time period for us could be extended into 2006. With that information we then scheduled a June 2006 trip. We received a phone call about a week prior to the stay to once again verify questions that had been answered before. One of the questions asked about income. I responded that I have retired since the originally scheduled date and as such I did not have any earned income, but rather only retirement income. I could not provide the necessary information to their satisfaction. They responded that without income information they could not provide me with the package and after a short discussion actually hung up the phone on me. I feel this was very rude and inconsiderate on their part. It became obvious that once I said I was retired their interest in me went to zero. It should be remenbered that the resort promotion people called me to extend the offer. After all this it looks like I am back to square one and have lost my deposit as well as my trip to Branson. This was my experience in dealing with Grand Crowne Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Don't give them your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did not actually take the vacation because of the reviews we read on the site. We did send the 99.00 required and after receiving the information from the resort we checked it out on line and found this web site which did not give good reviews of the time share. We called well with in our 14 days to cancel. It is now 2 weeks later and we have yet to receive our 99.00 back. They refuse to give us any information other than they are aware of our intent to cancel. It took a matter of a day to take our money but they still have not returned it at this time. Take our advise, save your time and money by not dealing with this business. I wish we would have hung up when they called us.

Reviews.Title: “Surrey Without any Fringe on Top”
Reviews.Author: JeepLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on a telemarketing tour package offer at some price I don’t recall at the moment. It seems that Surrey has a separate building at a separate location for everything. We first had to check in at the Grand Crowne Welcome Center to verify that we were qualified and we were given our first of 2 sets of tickets for attending the presentation the next day. Then we were sent up the hill to the Surrey Towne Center about a mile away to check in. We actually had to do that three times since we were too early the first time and they just didn’t have the room readiness verified the second time but the third time we waited while the guy radioed the security person to check out that it had been cleaned. We were given our key and directed to our building at Golfview about 2 miles away. We later learned that the only staff permanently on site are the security people. We found our room on the third floor. It was a “C” unit which is basically linear with the living room/kitchen in the front and the bedroom with whirlpool tub in the back. We had two of the smallest bathrooms I have ever seen. One had nothing more than the toilet with the sink outside the bathroom by the master bed. The other small bathroom in the front section behind the kitchen had toilet, sink and a shower unit. The water pressure was so low that very little water came out of the shower so it took a long time to rinse off. I found out during our tour that the “A” unit is even smaller while the “B” unit is the bigger one (more like a Fairfield deluxe that we are more used to) but we had the intermediate “C” sized unit. It really bugs me when people cut corners. Only one of the tables next to the couch had a lamp on it which made it difficult for two people to sit and read. The bed had 2 lights overhead but they were both on one switch with only one level: BRIGHT! The hot tub was very large and I would have to say unique. It didn’t seem to recirculate the water as most hot tubs do but rather bubbled vigorously which seemed to do the trick. The first night we tried it, it seemed to take forever to drain so on the second night I discovered that I had to hold the drain open until the tub was about 3/4 empty before I could release the drain without closing it. But the really unique thing about the tub is that after turning the tub off and draining it and waiting about a half hour while in bed it would mysteriously turn on again and shoot water up in the air which obviously had to be shut off again right away. This happened both nights we used the hot tub so it wasn’t just a fluke. Needless to say this can be a “mood chilling” event (to say the least) and definitely not on my top 10 list of things to do after getting out of a hot tub. (My wife suggested perhaps I needed to read the hot tub manual which was laminated on a card next to the hot tub — RI...GHT!) Perhaps because it was still under construction but there was very little evidence of landscaping and certainly no flowers. This is in sharp contrast to the Fairfield unit we had stayed at the nights before with flowers planted, plenty of shrubs and lakes, fountains, and streams. Golfview depends on the nearby public golf course for all of your views. These are brand new units. The ones that look done across the parking lot are still being worked on and there are all sorts of heavy equipment vehicles in the area. So, if everything is so new, why does one of the smoke alarms choose to start chirping at 4:00 a.m. and do so about every couple of minutes until we finally get up at 6:00 a.m. because we can’t take it any more? We called maintenance who took care of it while we were out. When we returned to our room later that afternoon, we discovered that neither of our room keys would work any more. The security guard let us in and said he would send maintenance around with a new set of key cards for us. They tried to justify it by saying that their keys are very sensitive to cell phones and such — bull! ... one, maybe, but not both keys at once since we had kept our keys separate and away from all cell phones, car keys, etc. that we had been warned can disrupt the magnetic strip on the key cards. The time share sales pitch at the Sales Center was rather uneventful after they learned that we already were owners at Fairfield. I had to laugh at one of the “closer” guys because to object to one of his pitches I mentioned that we were owners at Fairfield. I must have looked like I wasn’t sure I was getting through to him because he looked up and said “I know — I’m a Fairfield owner too.” We were out of there in less than 90 minutes. But of course the gift is given out at the “Gifting Building” which is located back up on Gretna Dr. I was glad that some of the other reviews had tipped me off about the post sales “Survey.” The guy couldn’t believe that we wouldn’t accept a $40 voucher for completing the survey and he even went so far as to offer $60 when I said “It’s really a pitch for your Vacation Club isn’t it?” To which he looked surprised and said, “Yes.” So if you decide to go for the high pressure Vacation Club sales pitch, at least see if they won’t sweeten the pot a bit. I figure my time is worth more than that. The tour guy had said something about computers in Building 6 in the basement with the workout equipment so after the tour we decided to check it out. There was some workout equipment which even in the slow season was being fully utilized but we found no computer equipment. There was one in a roped off area behind a desk that really didn’t look like they wanted guests to mess with. Other reviews have mentioned the indoor pool with the tennis court above it but we didn’t bother to go there. If I wanted to go somewhere in the Winter to swim, it probably wouldn’t be to Branson. There was a nice looking enclosed playground that the little kids seemed to enjoy. One night of our stay was unseasonably warm during the day getting up to 82 degrees in Winter! Whoever designed the bedroom failed to allow for a door or window to be opened with a screen because there were none. Fortunately there were few bugs this time of year so we just left the French door propped open all night. On another night there was a tornado warning. Unlike our experience a couple of days before at the Fairfield resort, we were never called but had to fend for ourselves. We did read the notice on the door which merely said to take shelter in the bathroom. I now wonder if there isn’t a basement area like Building 6 (ours was 7) that would have been a much better shelter from a possible tornado. Again we were fortunate to avoid the tornado but this time not the golf ball sized hail which pelted the cars in the parking lot. Obviously I have no desire to ever go back to the Grand Crowne Resort or as it is otherwise known as the “Surrey Vacation Resort.” Like Fairfield, there are many “Surreys” but this review is only about the one they call “Golfview.” By the way if you like to golf, Thousand Hills is a public course and you don’t have to stay at the Grand Crowne in order to golf. (We found Branson to be quite nice in the preseason. To read more about that, please read my review of the Fairfield Resort where we stayed for 2 days before moving over to this resort.) Branson has a lot of restaurants but few are exceptional. One of the best is the dining room at the Chateau on the Lake but it is quite expensive. We did get a great ribeye steak sandwitch ar Montana Mike's restaurant. But if you ever go to Branson over Thanksgiving, the ONLY place to go for a fantastic Thanksgiving dinner is The College of the Ozarks. Those students do a wonderful job and the facilities are very nice as well. All the locals know about it so expect to wait over an hour and plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “If their phone solicitation says anything...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If their phone solicitation protocol says anything at all these people are terrible. I asked them to take me off their list after politely listening to their information and they simply hung up on me. Not professional by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the trip and the Surrey Inn isn't as bad as some of the other people have”
Reviews.Author: bjones
Reviews.Content: I was just reading some of the reviews from some of the people who have stayed at the Surrey inn and I have to completely disagree with all of those who said bad things. The room we stayed in was not bad at all actually it was nicer that others I have stayed in in the past. The time-share presentation wasn't bad either. Yeah, we were in there a little longer than the promised 90 minutes but we did ask some questions because we are interested in time-share. Our sales people weren't rude but were motivated to make a sale if possible. Of course, that's how they make their living. You also have to consider how some people are: if things don't go exactly how they want they have to try to blame someone else for their misfortune or bad mood. Anyway, to each his own. It was well worth the price we paid for the package and will probably do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Vet's DAy weekend review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were contacted by Grand Crowne several months ago for a time share presentation. For our time and effort we would receive for show tickets. We were told that the presentation would be 90 minutes (fine print minimum of 90 minutes). It lasted 2 hours and 15 minutes. We were willing to hear the Grand Crowne reps. out though. Our previewer was Brandi, very good at her job. The time share format of interval ownership is okay if you have the money to spend on it. If you have to borrow the money, it is like a mortgage. But if you finance through Grande Crown the rate is 19% interest. We niether had the money, nor were were willing to use their financing. Also unwilling to charge it on a credit card and try to work out our own financing later. Also the motel accomidations were merely passable. No hot water for morning showers the first day. Some guests spoken to had no hot water in the morning for the previous two days. Guests had called repeatedly. This was fixed only after personally speaking with the manager and the maintenance crew working on it for half a day. The motel is owned by the same owner as the time share. If they can't satisfy preview motel guests they are trying to sell to (NO HOT WATER), how are they going to satisfy owners that are already locked in to a contract?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the condo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the Grand Crowne Condos. The Surrey Inn Hotel was so-so. We went to the presentation a year ago and it was nice and everyone was professional. Our particular salesman was a good salesman, but he wasn't pushy and worked with us to fit our budget. We went for our vacation last week in our condo for the first time and had a wonderful time. The condo was perfect, everyone was friendly and they even gave more vouchers, so most our big meals were free. Since we had already bought the timeshare, we didn't expect that.

Reviews.Title: “time share beware”
Reviews.Author: gmar11
Reviews.Content: The "approximately" 90 minute time share presentation we attended lasted about 2 hrs and 45 minutes. At about 2 1/2 hrs, after already declining the potential sale several times, we adamently requested to leave and were told if we did we would forfeit the incentives which brought us to the program. My wife and I kept our part of the bargain time wise and felt the salesperson and manager did not keep theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Should be renamed "SORRY"”
Reviews.Author: JJA08
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the worst beds and pillows I have ever slept on!!! The bed had a huge hump in the middle and the pillows were old and lumpy/flat. There was only a sheet and comforter on the beds but that was ok since the a/c wasn't working properly... The door would not close all the way and the deadbolt could not be engaged. My kids feet were black after walking around the room barefoot for about 15 min. You had to walk up a hill to get to an ironing board (right off of the pool - which was nice and had pool towels). There was in-room coffee that was terrible, a hair dryer and mystery soap in a dispenser on the shower wall. Cont. Breakfast was cereal, toast, english muffins, doughnuts, apple sauce, juice, milk and coffee (a little better than the in-room coffee). The towels were clean and fluffy but had a strange chemical odor. We had to walk up a hill to get to breakfast and pool but early in the morning you could catch a ride on a golf cart....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family vacation!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family visited grand crown. It was a very nice family vacation. The kids had a great time. There was alot of activities for them. The resort staff was very friendly. I would highly recommend this resort..........:)

Reviews.Title: “A horrible stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Branson several times with my parents. I thought it would be a wonderful place to take my children. We got a call inviting us to stay, and we paid our money. I would have preferred if they would have just given us money for a hotel and let us pick our own place to stay. If you want someone to spend the money you are asking for your time-shares, at least put them up in a place that does not have black mold on the wall by the door. I was not at all impressed with the hotel room or the staff. The presentation was fine, but when we told them that we were not interested, that is when the attitudes started coming out. The "manager" that came to our table did not take "no" for an answer and got down right rude with us. We decided to go to the "Post-Presentation" they call it. We were going to get our $40 and tell them what we thought. Well, don't buy-in. This so-called "Post-Presentation" is just another 60 minute chance to try to sell to you again. There is a survey that you fill out in the beginning and then they talk for over 60 minutes about travel packages. We were told this at the beginning of the session and we told them that we would give them 60 minutes, but nothing over. They were not going to suck up anymore of our time. We were told that we would not be able to leave in the middle of the presentation, the 60 minute mark. They gave us back our deposit and asked us to leave. (You have to put up a $20 deposit to ensure that you will be at their presentation.) The shows were great and we had a blast except for the time spent at the hotel and dealing with the rudeness of the staff. Thank you for your time and I hope this helps you make some decisions.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment - rude salespeople”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went on this trip through a sales promo from Grand Crowne Resorts(first one I've followed through on in about 5-7 years). Driving up to this hotel, the first impression is possibly a 4 star hotel until you enter the room - wall paper peeling in the corners, dirty sink & we had to ask for towells the very first day we were there. Their idea of a "super continental breakfast" was a joke. If you want a reasonably priced average quality hotel with a great continental breakfast, try the Ramada by the Dixie Stampede. The only good qualities this hotel had were 2 outdoor & 1 indoor pool, a golf cart to shuttle people back & forth, & the people at the front desk were very friendly. The sales promo of course, was right smack in the middle of our first whole day there, so you figure 3 nights, you have 2 whole days, now one day is shot because you're there to fit into their schedule, they're making no effort to work around yours.
