After sitting through about 70 minutes of mindless rambling as to why this is such a great deal a younger high pressure salesman came & sat down at my table. The " great deal" that started at approximately $9,500.00 in the presentation, where they claimed they make minimal profit, immediately fell to about $3,500.00 when they realized I was less than impressed with their "so called" carrot. When I didn't immediately write out a check for the bargain they claimed they were giving me, I was no longer their best friend, but the biggest imbecile in the face of the earth. After I rejected the younger salesmans offer, he left the table & an older man came & sat down & really tried to tighten the screws. I told him to send the information home with me & I'd think about it, but I refused to purchase anything that day because that's not how I do business. His reply was "that wasn't how they did business, because no one ever follows through under those circumstances". (There's a reason for that) ... He also informed me these "carrots" (low quality rooms & tickets to shows & rides no one wants) cost them money & ask that I never reply to another sales promo again. By their own math at the promo & the rates posted on the door to my hotel room, even with the discount rate we paid for the room, they still made money. (assuming of course, that their markups aren't enhanced to make their packages look better) I've stayed at plenty of hotels in my life from holes in the wall, to 5 star. If you want a reasonably priced, average quality hotel to stay at while in Branson, there's plenty available, but this isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Bought 1 week with Crown Resorts but Hated Surrey Inn”
Reviews.Author: GoGoGirlNow
Reviews.Content: We have attended several time share presentations before, we live in Arkansas and like to visit Branson occasionally, especially with our grandchildren ages 8 and 12 now. This time share package was competitively priced but the accomodations were terrible! We loathed the Surrey Inn because of the following: Breakfast was a joke, few choices and worst of all closed at 9:30 a.m.!! Imagine going on a "vacation" with kids and eating by 9:30. Not for us even if we are early risers usually. The room and area was not well kept. Our commode stopped up several times - horrible! When we arrived there was a plunger next to it - we soon found out why. Extremely hilly if you can not walk but with a golf cart service in the early a.m. only. No towels at the pool for 3 days. Nice laundry room adjacent to the pool. The presentation was O.K., we attended an early one. Food was available, we did get a very new salesperson who did not give us a hard sell which was great. But then again we had been to several others. There were several sales people around us really loud and pushy though. The deal "closer" came last and offered another deal, good only that day of course. We declined. We were then sent to a third person to receive our tickets. She offered us a 7 day package we took with the intentions of staying at the newest facility on the Golf Course. It is a good location. After having called the Crowne resort lines to schedule, I have been treated very well. We will give an update in the Spring! But stay away from the Surrey Inn!

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS BAD AS THESE PEOPLE WRITE, OKAY FOLKS!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, first of all I might say that I read all the reviews, then called the resort to cancel my trip based on the negative reviews. I am smart enough to know that most people will take time to write negative comments, but won't take the time to write if a positive experience was had. However, I got a little nervous that I would have a horrible trip if I went. I talked to the PR manager who gave me her name and location in case someone was being rude. The check in was painless, received my food voucher as promised and off to the room we went. The next day my tour was scheduled, and we showed up as scheduled. We had a really nice down to earth gentleman named Fred, and our tour took about the 90 minutes promised. I told him up front that I bought the package several months ago, and I was now not in a position to buy anything since I have bought a new house to close on soon and my current house is unsold. He was understanding and very nice even though he knew the situation. When he was done, another man came to "finish" the procedure. He wrote out the price on a piece of paper, and then kind of shoved it at me. I told him that I couldn't do it as I had told Fred. He then said he could get me into a cheaper deal and wrote that out and gave it to me. I again declined which he didn't appreciate and signed off on my paperwork. Then, the third closer guy came and gave me another "deal" if I bought "today" and I also declined that deal. He was decent, nice and in no way pushy. I then picked up my show tickets as promised and we were on our way. They do have an exit interview, but I made it clear at booking time that due to another obligation I could not attend and I wasn't pushed to do so. The accomodations were better than average, and we were treated very well by all the staff. I would do it again, and it was well worth my 90 minutes. Thanks for a great trip and thanks to Fred.

Reviews.Title: “Lies to sell time shares”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just want to expose some things. When I purchased a week it was because I was assured how easy it was to sell. False They do offer to buy it back at "15%" of what I paid. But they sure don't make any attempt to sell for you like I was told they would. And I was told that I could roll over points that were not used to use in the following use year. They failed or neglected to tell me that the points expire at the end of Jan, Thats one month into the use year. But I will have fun telling everyone who will listen my story of Time Share Heaven
